channel.title: Spock - C# presentation app
channel.description:
I'm trying to create a slideshow application like powerpoint but dumbed down a lot.. For some weird reason that I already forgot, I decided the name of the project would be 'Spock'.
Old(er) video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5otu0mxM-qQ
New video: (you might want to watch it in HD and fullscreen) http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AS7zTaFMvWg Going from one slide to the other is actually a lot smoother than in the video..
Download link if you'd like to give it a try: [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?kdu5k37bkwl302w]MediaFire - 61.57KB[/url] MediaFire already scans the .exe for viruses.. And if you still don't trust it, then don't download it
Right now you're also able to add a youtube-video into the slideshow, but that's not included in the uploaded version because I have to improve the way this is done first :I
I'm also working on a GUI for creating the slides without having to write every slide and object down in a textfile
Any feedback or tips about what else I can add to it will be greatly appreciated (:
[hr] 08/07/13 Update: * You can now include videos from youtube * You can change the fore- and background color, the size and the font of text * The slides don't stop working anymore when you push a button a couple of times
Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=J7aQb3jfDkg
Download: [url=http://www.mediafire.com/?kdu5k37bkwl302w]MediaFire - 30.14KB[/url]

item.title: Spock - C# presentation app
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

This looks cool. Reminds me in some senses of prezzi. Might be able to get some inspiration from them. For example, you could allow the person to set arbitrary locations for each slide on this (visualized) giant area of presentable material, then allow the program to select any number of transitions, where you’re just moving the camera around, perhaps doing zoom or fade effects, etc. Similar to what you have now, but with arbitrary locations it lends to much more flexibility.

Keep up the work, though.

Read full topic

item.title: Spock - C# presentation app
item.dc:creator: @Kattoor Snow_
item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

Lin:

Looks neat. I would recommend smoothing the animation out - not in the sense that it lags, but make it like the iOS where the speed decreases when it nears the finish. Also you should make templates, like power point. Add options like centering, and overall make it more like HTML.

Working on it!
Thanks for the feedback

Read full topic

item.title: Spock - C# presentation app

item.description:

Looks neat. I would recommend smoothing the animation out - not in the sense that it lags, but make it like the iOS where the speed decreases when it nears the finish. Also you should make templates, like power point. Add options like centering, and overall make it more like HTML.

item.description:
@Kattoor wrote:

Actually I haven’t spent much time on it.
I’d say max. like 10hours, but never more than 2hours on the same day due to lack of time…
